data.title: Install 'code' command in PATH when not Administrator
data.body:
I can't install `code` command-line on my school OS X session because I'm not the Administrator of the computer I work on.

I have to trick and put the previous command-line on my .zshrc, but it does not work well (sometimes only focuses on VSCode instead of opening the requested folder), and then I have a VSCode popup asking me to remove it from my `.zshrc` and install from the editor EACH time I open a window.

It would be cool to permit to install this as a non-Administrator.

data.title: .bash_profile not sourced in integrated terminal on mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Toggle open the integrated terminal from VS Code
2. Notice that it has not sourced from `.bash_profile` as terminal does when opening a new window.

I have to run `source ~/.bash_profile` every time I open the integrated terminal the first time after starting code.

Perhaps I've missed documentation somewhere about how to have it always source the `.bash_profile` file?

data.title: editor.trimAutoWhitespace doesn't re-indent on pressing Enter

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

![vscode-why](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79215/16054262/334ecb36-3221-11e6-8aba-d61fb9d49650.gif)

When on an auto un-indented line, hitting enter should reset to the correct indent. Vim currently does this (although it might be a plugin I'm using?). I tested in Sublime too and was fairly surprised to find out Sublime doesn't correct the indent on hitting enter either.

data.title: Keybinding With terminal.close Command Doesn't Close Terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0 Insider
- OS Version: OSX 10.11

Steps to Reproduce:
- create keybinding with `terminal.close` action

`{ "key": "escape", "command": "workbench.action.terminal.close", "when": "editorFocus" }`
- if the terminal was originally closed, it will open. If the terminal is open, it will reload.

data.title: Override Theme on a Rule by Rule Basis

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: OSX 10.11

This would be a "**nice to have**." In Sublime, you could apply a theme globally, and then override it piece by piece. For example, if I were to apply the Material theme, but wanted a different color for string tokens, I could override it in a "User Theme" file.

data.title: HC theme - close action not rendered in tab header
data.body:
HC theme does not render the tab header close action. Also the dirty notification is not rendered

![screen shot 2016-06-14 at 16 50 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16047393/29f2a20e-3250-11e6-8426-4489b40eb0a1.png)

data.title: Find & Replace UX ideas
data.body:
One idea is to reuse as much of the search UI we already have. Each entry in the search viewlet could show a preview of the replace operation and clicking on an entry could open the diff editor to actually show a before/after using the text editor.

Mockup:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/16046809/04ea83de-324e-11e6-9552-73edfc7c1842.png)

data.title: Editor actions are hard to discover when tabs are enabled
data.body: Due to limited space in a tab, we put the editor actions into the context menu. This makes them much harder to use and explore compared to having them visible with icons in the title header when tabs are disabled.

data.title: Resizing groups with multiple editors causes tab header flashing
data.body:
1. Have multiple tabs open and have editors side by side
2. Resize the editor group and hold the mouse down - notice a weird disco flashing in the tab headers (it looks more crazy but gif captures only some frames)

![disco](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16045870/ae182aa0-324a-11e6-919d-e5b04992f279.gif)

data.title: Ctrl + tab and Ctrl + Shift + tab behaves like in Browsers with tabs enabled

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
With tabs enabled, I think it would be nice to have <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>tab</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>shift</kbd> + <kbd>tab</kbd> behave like the same way as in browser. 

As we switch back and forth from browser to editor, this flow would be very helpful

data.body:

data.title: Rendering glitch for tab headers custom scrollbar
data.body:
Sorry I do not have repro steps but happened to me 2 times so far. Both times it happened when I switched back to vscode from some other active window.

Opening a new tab triggers a new layout which fixes the brokeness

![screen shot 2016-06-14 at 15 54 03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16045357/59b6a394-3248-11e6-87b9-5e5173e67fb8.png)

data.title: Diff view needs more UX affordance when tabs enabled
data.body:
Enable tabs and open a diff view. Notice the following:
1. Diff view is rendered the same as a regular editor view - we should add some affordance so there is a clear difference between the two when looking at the tab header
2. There are no more top level diff view actions - this is fine as this space is now occupied by tabs - but this actions should be present in the secondary top level actions

![screen shot 2016-06-14 at 15 47 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16045118/65119c5e-3247-11e6-8a10-74447f6420dd.png)

data.title: Cannot read property 'uri' of null: TypeError
data.body:
Just noticed this in my insiders console, I have no clue how I got there though:

```
//Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:115 Cannot read property 'uri' of null: TypeError: Cannot read property 'uri' of null
    at asLocation (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/css/node_modules/vscode-languageclient/lib/protocolConverter.js:148:49)
    at asDefinitionResult (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/css/node_modules/vscode-languageclient/lib/protocolConverter.js:143:16)e.onUnexpectedError @ //Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:115
//Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:97 [Extension Host] rejected promise not handled with 1 second

```

/cc @alexandrudima @aeschli @jrieken

data.title: Git: editor input cache is not aware of disposed inputs
data.body:
When you click on an entry in the git viewlet, we seem to use cached inputs to prevent creating inputs on each click. However, when you click through diff inputs, we now dispose them more aggressively. This results in the git viewlet opening inputs which are disposed (and thus have their event listeners disposed). The visible bug is that you loose dirty indicators if you start to type in the editor.

My fix is to make the cache aware of inputs getting disposed.

/cc @joaomoreno

data.title: Commenting out in tsx file
data.body:
Right now when I use `cmd+/` in tsx file in jsx part of the file: eg. on second line of: ```
...
``` then it will convert it to ```
//
...
``` It would be awesome if it could turn it into ```
{/*
...
*/}
```

data.title: Peek definition for import {} in TypeScript
data.body:
Imagine this code

def.ts:

```
export interface Message {
  name: string
}
```

code.ts: 

```
import {Message} from './def'
import * as def from './def'

let test1:Message
let test2:def.Message
```

When I peek definition of `Message` in `let test1:Message` i only get `import {Message} from './def'` - it would be awesome if it was smart enough to determine that i'm importing interface `Message` and give me definition of that interface. Works fine for `let test2:def.Message` case

data.title: extract markdown into an extension
data.body: Extracts colorizing and previewing of markdown files into its own extension as described in #6106.

data.title: Split editor action does not show as disabled when limit hit
data.body:
Open 3 editors side by side - notice the split editor action is still enabled. I would expect this action to be disabled - especially now since it is next to an action that has its enablement nicely updated

![screen shot 2016-06-14 at 12 06 59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16039149/8741cf20-3228-11e6-958d-f555ecd6294d.png)

data.title: Never show pinEditor action when "workbench.previewEditors": false
data.body:
Set "workbench.previewEditors": false, context menu on tab - notice the pin action disabled.
If the previewEditors are disabled this action should never be shown.

Simlar to how we do not show save action in open editors context menu when auto save enabled.

data.title: Find widget does not blend well when tabs enabled
data.body:
IMHO the find widget does not visually blend well when tabs are enabled
Two similar gray colors and no seperation between them does not look good to me.

Just my 2 cents so feel free to close

![screen shot 2016-06-14 at 11 52 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16038735/c96b8384-3226-11e6-928a-cc8b32627301.png)

data.title: Wrong input box color in dark theme

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In light theme for input boxes we use the same background color as the one used for editor, however in dark theme that is not the case.
This becomes particularly visible when tabs are enabled as the quick open input has the same color as the empty after the tabs - looks confusing and this is the main reason why tabs visually look much better in the light theme than in the dark theme imho.

I can look into changing all the input box background colors but it is a big change and it requires UX blessing - so we can discuss it today in the ux meeting.

fyi @bpasero 

![screen shot 2016-06-14 at 11 41 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/16038481/65d2cff4-3225-11e6-95ef-4299dde5411b.png)

data.title: Cmd + number should focus editor at index and not focus groups or split
data.body:
1. Have multiple tabs open
2. Press cmd + 2 - expect that the second tab gets focus (like in all other aps)
3. Instead a new editor group gets created

While in tab mode cmd + number should always focus that tab. Opening a new group should have a stronger shorctur (more keybindings).

I think this could be solved by just adding additional shortcuts in keybindings.json on appropriate positions because Alex gives priority based on where in file it appears.

data.title: Tab: explore to keep close button stable when rapidly closing
data.body: Even though we have non-equal width tabs it would be nice if you could rapidly close tabs without moving the mouse.

data.title: keybindgs.json "key" does not tolerate spaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Open `keybindgs.json` and have the following keybinding
`{ "key": "cmd + d", "command": "editor.action.deleteLines", "when": "editorTextFocus" },`

Notice the space around the + in "key". Due to that this keybinding does not get registered.
I would expect that the spaces around the + get ignored.

data.title: custom paths are not included in vscode env.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider (1.3.0-insider)
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Captain

Steps to Reproduce:
- with latest insider build, append any custom path to PATH in .bashrc or using [dotfile](https://github.com/mathiasbynens/dotfiles)
- create a node script using shelljs

```
console.log(shellJs.exec('echo $PATH').stdout);
```
- launch debug (if you are using nvm, then you have to set `runtimeExecutable` to the version you want. vscode doesn't work any more with default node version set by nvm)

the log shows only `/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin` as path

it worked with stable version and old insider version (not nightly ones)
